caption: Excellent attention and delicious food!
(Translated by Google) Fantastic place 👍  (Original) Fantástico lugar 👍
Great service 👏  and food Great place, we split the dinner  👍

Delightful. There's a very 'carribe meets the far east' feel. You'll feel like you're lounging just off the turquoise waters of Arawakay Bay while you peruse the daily oyster offering and perfectly paired full dishes (no need to order sides, although they're there for those with bigger eyes). The portions were surprisingly massive for the quality being served. The strong influence across the menu was thai (green curried shrimp, coconut milk broth, etc), amisdt some Szechuan style ingredients (soy braised lotus root, for example). Despite some other reviews, the staff was especially attentive and thoughtful. I wouldn't miss this Asian fusion treat - definitely worth a trip around the block for parking.

This was our SECOND trip here and again we were disappointed! The bartender, I did not catch her name but she had long hair and had a very bubbley attitude, was doing her best to keep up with the bar and drinks out in the restaurant while the manager sat around and did minimal to assist! We ordered the appetizer sampler and it showed up very quick. We asked for horseradish and it never showed up so we had to ask again and the bartender finally brought it. Again, she's doing her best to keep up and I have no issues with her effort! I wouldn't recommend eating here and we will not be returning!
Lapeer is the highest rated seafood dining experience in Atlanta.
Wow, what an awesome find. Great oysters, salt and pepper calamari, FRIED RICE, curry, cocktails. Surprisingly, the lobster special was a bit lacking but still highly recommend. Will be coming back.

Lapeer Seafood Market is the "IT" place to dine in downtown Alpharetta!  My extended family had a fantastic early Xmas dinner on short notice at Lapeer. In short,  the level of professionalism,  attention to detail, quality and personal dedication exceeded our expectations.  Scott selected great appetizers and dishes that hit all notes. Chef Blake was kind enough to visit our table multiple times and made us truly feel appreciated. Serving staff was knowledgeable and most helpful. The seafood dishes have an Asian twist bringing new rich flavors to established menu items all worth trying. The Jerk Chicken was the favorite poultry dish. The house Margarita mixed with Mezcal is life changing.  The restaurant itself has a spacious modern design with warm lighting. Music selection was seasonal, appropriate and at the perfect volume level to catch the holiday spirit while being able to have a table conversation. Lastly, the covid-19 arrangements were well thought out and made us feel even more comfortable to enjoy the ambiance and experience.
Amazing!
Excellent food and ambience!
This one of my go to eating spots when I travel to the L.A. area. The food is delightful and bountiful

The food was good, but just okay. Our waitress wasn't very friendly or attentive. Due to the fact that servers have to wear masks and the music is still playing loudly, it was hard to hear. Overall the atmosphere was great. Yummy bites, but in general just okay good for the price.
Nice upscale atmosphere, great food, very good service.....
Simple: food was excellent and the service was exemplary.

Really really really good. From our drinks, to appetizers, to our main dish, everything was absolutely delicious. Love the vibe and decor, also. Service was spot on and very knowledgeable. We will be back.
I love coming here. Great staff, atmosphere, and even better food!
Delicious from start to finish, the quality of ingredients and passion for using them came through in each and every dish.
My experience with Andrew Ahlquist is enough to make me never ever return to this place. Awful employee. Remove from your team immediately.

Let me make this cut and dry. Atmosphere: 5/5 beautiful decor and the outside is gorgeous. Service: From the host to the bartender ( I sat at the bar) attentive , kind, knowledgeable 5/5 Food : Appearance Clearly you can tell 5/5 NOW. The oysters tasted delicious briny just the way I like it I forgot the names.. it was perfect but for 2/5 oysters both had broken shell pieces. Scallops gorgeous everything from the romesco cauliflower to the crispy rice and the puree and seared pineapple and especially the scallops cooked perfectly.  My issue? No seasoning.... Very bland. Therefore 4/5 will come back to try the oysters again and maybe drinks probably not for the protein there.

The food was absolutely fresh and delicious. Tasty calamari, wonderful scallops, superb steelhead trout. Service was fabulous, helpful recommendations, attentive and caring. Only less than positive comment is portion size was small to moderate. But we had a great experience overall.

This is basically the only restaurant my family and I eat at. It’s even my 18 month old daughter’s favorite too!  The peel and eat shrimp is one of the best dishes I’ve ever had and the staff is so friendly! Not to mention the gorgeous ambiance! I always get excited to eat at Lapeer.  Omg don’t even get me started on how delicious the margaritas are!  In fact, we love it so much that we are having our rehearsal dinner there next month and the Main Street Margarita will be the signature drink at our wedding!
Overpriced but food was good. Public parking available.
Food very good, prices too high, felt rushed by waitress but service very good
Went to lapeer for some drinks, was wonderfully treated by Richard and Ally behind the bar, had some delicious happy hour bites and cocktails!

If I had to describe Lapeer in one word I think of exquisite! The dishes are made fresh and the combination of ingredients brought together is very original and super delicious. Combine it with an outstanding service in a natural but cozy setting you get exquisite! Truly exceptional! Yet another great success, well done!
Out of 6 people they got only 1 entree warm. The rest were cold as ice. It took 50 minutes for the food to get to our table.
Great seafood restaurant with a huge mezcal selection. Open and airy bar, well lit, and clean and tidy. Bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable. I like this one!

This restaurant is located right in the downtown area. Great service and really nice feel to it. The food was ok, not great! Portions were small and the NY Strip should be taken off the menu...came out it in two cut chunks.  Really nice restaurant just to try, but nothing special to make me come back.

Atmosphere was romantic, wine selection had large variety of great wines and food was to die for. The presentation was very bespoke and greatly added to our wonderful dining experience. The best was the service from our waiter 'Johnny Depp' he was one of the best waiters we have ever been served by. We were allowed to relax and enjoy our individual courses without each course being rushed. We were made feel very welcome and cannot wait to return again soon.
Nice place, very kind and attentive staff, octopus appetizer was awesome!

This was a great experience. The food was like artwork, although the portions are a little light. You will not be over stuffed. The red snapper meal busts with flavor.  The lobster roll is delicious.  The sea scallops were awesome as well but they could have added more scallops on our plate. We also had the  shrimp and cured trout for starters. Wow extremely tasty. This is not a cheap place but they offer a good value for the price. I would allocate about $35 00 to $50.00 person for the experience depending on what you order and drink. The only reason for taking away one star is that the serving can be a little larger.

Love the ambiance, the service, and the flavorful food. Thank you Lapeer for helping make my wife's birthday special and for staying late for us so we could go retrieve a lost purse even after closing. Highly recommend!
Service was a bit slow and the trout undercoocked. The decor and location are a plus.
Bartenders can make really great cocktails and food is excellent. Great date night place to go.
So good. Everthing was delicious. My 2 year old son is not a fan of fish, but he ate every bite of his fish dinner. Well be back!
Lunch was great, beautiful location and restaurant. Service very attentive. I will return.

Very warm and inviting atmosphere with a perfect combination of delicious food and cocktails. The lobster roll is a must....scrumptious. Great service - wait staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of all the dishes...it is a MUST if you visit Alpharetta!!! I can't wait to return....

Lapeer’s bar is second to none. Beyond being gorgeous and comfortably chic, I found their cocktails to be fabulous and their service flawless. Last Saturday, Cody went out of his way to concoct for me a to-die-for glass of deliciousness made with my favorite ginger liqueur and Prosecco. I actually have no idea what else went in to his creation so I guess (twist my arm), I’ll have to go back for more! Coupled with their scallops, it was a perfect evening and experience. I was impressed and will be back!
Awesome atmosphere, good vibe, incredible food & cocktails!!!!  Great staff & service!!!
Excellent menu and save room for the lemon curd dessert!!
$50.00 for lunch , for 1, small portions, left hungry , food good but doubled priced
Excellent food and awesome service from our waiter Louis. Definitely will be going back.
For $17 I expected a much larger piece of fish, but ok. Very flaky! Coleslaw was iffy.

Worst experience ever! Booked for a bday dinner, arrived at 6:30, ordered a small app, salad and a bottle of wine. Also put in order for our main. At 8:15 we were still sitting, table of 6, no mains, no drink top up. Nothing! We ended up getting the bill and leaving to find another place to eat...and for our trouble?  The manager comp’d the salad!!!! Seriously?? We went across to Smoke Jack, had phenomenal service from Savannah, all mains brought to us within 15 mins. Shame on you, Lapeer, never again!!
You go to a restaurant for an experience and food you can't begin to imagine making. That's what you get here, well thought out flavors, fresh seafood, and an overall fantastic experience.
Really fresh and tasty food. I recommend getting the side of fried bread that has lemon curd and sugar on them. They're like mini doughnut holes but better.
Delicious food, gorgeous restaurant with a great atmosphere. Love coming here.
One of the best experiences I have had in the city, the lobster roll is to die for. Shaved steelhead trout is a must try, no doubt about it.

Such an awesome place. Great atmosphere, great staff and amazing food. Normally go for happy hour, 4-6 weekdays, and normally get 1$ oysters and fish dip. Too many good things to say about this place, also bottomless mimosas at brunch on the weekend!
We were so pleased with the service, which is becoming difficult to find.
I enjoyed the food and service was great. We will go back there before big catch again.
We all loved our food and customer service was phenomenal!
Favorite spot to come for drinks! Incredible staff and incredible cocktails!
Beautiful atmosphere but way overpriced for amount of seafood servings! Much better seafood restaurants around that serve decent portions at same price!
Amazing meal! Great atmosphere. And incredible service

Lovely setting and great ambience!! I had the snapper which was prepared perfectly and exactly the way I love it. I also enjoyed the vegetables that it came with. We also had the smoked fish dip... amazing. We will definitely be going back.

Average food - Bland! Small portions! $39 for maybe a 6oz portion of Halibut and some okra. My wife had the mussels and pasta which tasted good definitely not worth the price tag. Service was average at best! Will not be back! Not worth it!!!
Fantastic! These are one if each of the oysters. Highly recommend the Halibut.
Nice atmosphere, bit pricey.  Don't order the steak tartare, was not prepared properly.   Some of the other dishes looked better.
Highly recommend, very exclusive cousine.... repeat over and over!!
Great menu. Fresh herbs with every dish. Vibrant atmosphere. Very good service. Extensive spirits menu. Only recommendation would be a more robust wine list. Outstanding overall!

The waitress told me the crab cake would not be enough for the main. Didn’t believe her but she was right. The portions are beyond small. Felt like a scam. The volume in the restaurant is also on the high side making it difficult to hear others at your table.

This place is incredible. The atmosphere was friendly and laid back. The food and drinks had an impressive amount of love and care. My wife and I visited for our 3rd wedding Anniversary. So impressed and awed at the service and detail. 💯😋
The restaurant is beautiful/cool, but man is it loud. Dinner was good but portions were quite small/pricey.
Craft cocktails are fantastic!

My wife and I experienced Lapeer restaurant a couple of weeks ago.  While the restaurant location, decoration, and service were great, we were both disappointed with our entrees and the portion sizes for the price.  My wife had the Halibut which was served in a seafood broth with vegetables.  I had the Lobster Roll with warm lemon butter and VooDoo Chips.  The Halibut portion size was very small, the seafood broth unremarkable, and the entree came with no side dishes. At $36 it was way over priced.  As a comparison, Atlanta Fish Market offers Halibut at $26 with a portion size that is at least twice as large and is served with two sides.  My Lobster Roll had a small portion of lobster (about 3-4 oz.) and consisted of a small piece of lobster tail with the remainder lobster claw meat, wrapped in a flat bread.  The home made VooDoo chips were okay, but the combination was hardly filling given the portion size.  Certainly not worth $30 by any means.  As an aside, I also found one of their signature cocktails, the "Queen Anne's Revenge", to be one of the worst tasting frozen rum cocktails I have ever had.  I would not recommend it.  Needless to say we do not plan on returning.  For anyone looking for a great seafood restaurant I would recommend Atlanta Fish Market in Buckhead, or closer to Alpharetta, Atlantic Seafood on Mansell Road.

I think the best way to describe my experience here is by repeating what one of the staff of waiters said when he dropped off a plate of rolls -- it's his favorite thing there and would eat them for his entire dinner if he could. Truth.  While I'm on the subject, the rolls are sublime. Soft, plump density with a sprinkle or salt over the top. So good.  Not trying to detract from the rest of the meal, the other stuff was good. The challenges I found here was that their endeavor to locally source keeps their menu pretty limited. Not usually a problem unless you're wanting the Thursday special crab cakes on Wednesday.  I tried an order of tuna cubes appetizer for a meal along with a salad. The tuna cubes were sushi grade and quite good. Presentation was beautiful. I was afraid to eat it. The salad -- interesting taste but a bit overpowering.  The "chips" that come with the fried fish are an odd pairing. Big sticks of potatoes rather than traditional fries. Decent but not my favorite. They had good seasoning but lacked enough of it. The thickness of the potato seemed to absorb a lot of it.  Service was excellent here. The interior space is gorgeous, complimented by a well-stocked bar with a cocktail menu you can appreciate. Price point dining here is $$$. $100 for two with a drink each.  I liked it but don't know if I'd go back. The parking and traffic at Alpharetta City Center is aggravating, and this place doesn't make me overlook it.

Wow. This place is so cool. The decor is a blend of modern farmhouse meets modern art deco. We sat at the bar because we were only there for cocktails. Timothy was our bartender and he did not disappoint. I asked him to make me his two favorite cocktails, both not on the menu. By far the best cocktails I've had OTP, Trinidad Sour Cocktail and another made with white rum. We will definetly be back.
Great food, great service, and excellent wait staff. Chef also came out to answer a question that we had regarding an item on the menu. We will be back.
Tasty. Try it once... come back forever

This was our first time trying it. The place is beautifully designed with a nice atmosphere. Every dish we tried was carefully prepared and had attention to detail. Every bite was delicious. The spaghetti with clams had a delicate combination of ingredients that was really enjoyable. The dessert was great as well. A beautiful key lime pie with a home made merengue. Highly recommend it if you are in the mood of trying something well prepared and different in the Alpharetta downtown area. Only suggestion to the restaurant is to keep adding and improving dishes during different seasons. We will be back.
Amazing new restaurant in downtown Alpharetta. Can’t recommend brunch there enough - the lobster omelet and fried oysters with homemade hot sauce were fantastic. Worth the drive.
We had a party of 6 and everyone loved the food, service and cocktails. Oysters, crab salad, peel and eat shrimp, Spaghetti a la chitarra...everything was terrific. Looking forward to next time.
Excellent food and drinks, great mezcal cocktails

The atmosphere was alive and fun. The decor was great but the restaurant is VERY loud, especially on the enclosed patio. We could hardly hear each other at our table. Definitely need to work on the “acoustics” in that space. The food was good but the portions are very/too small for the price. The service was average. Not stellar but not bad either. I was hoping to be wow’d based on what I had heard and it was ok.

The absolute epitome of a down town Alpharetta, GA experience. Incredibly phenomenal staff and gorgeous contemporary-coastal restaurant feel.  Literally the best fresh/new take on classic seafood in the Atlanta area. Coupled with it’s extremely educated bar and service staff, this is one of most enjoyable restaurants in the country.

I met a friend here recently to grab a quick bite, we ended up staying two hours because this place is so cozy.  The food was delicious and the staff is very friendly. After dinner order a drink and sit on the couch for a while and enjoy the views of beautiful downtown Alpharetta.
So far so good for the first time! I only had the octopus but it was delicious! The wines are great by the glass. Beautiful atmosphere, looking forward to coming back!
What a poor experience! It’s a Beautiful restaurant but the service is horrible!!! Hostess are rude!!! The Food was ok and not worth the attitude of the staff!!
New addition to Alpharetta that focuses on seafood...finally

Drinks delicious, had the Fish & Chips subbed the potato wedges for actual chips. A tad salty but the fish was crispy and tasty. Took a bit to arrive but the ambiance and the experience was nice. It is a bit pricey but I guess you get what you pay for. I'd definitely recommend for a girls night  out or a date night!!!

Great atmosphere and decor. Very trendy place. The food was excellent and the service was prompt and friendly. My only complaint is the entree sizes for the prices. The lunch portions were tiny. This is a great place for a date night. Free WiFi and plenty of parking nearby.
Good oysters.  The rest was just OK and over priced.  Many better options in the area.
Amazing atmosphere! Great seafood! Oyster selection was awesome! Zach was a great server as well!
Absolutely delicious!  Hands on owner and great chef. Great atmosphere.

Very cool bar area and enclosed patio. Wait staff needs some experience. Not smooth at all :( Didn’t even offer forks for my cake my mom brought me-not cool.  Fish n Chips off the chart yummy. Loved the red snapper. Drinks were great.
2 hours to get food. Plates are very small. Be prepared to drop $200 and leave hungry. Just be ause it's expensive doesn't mean it's good. Tons of better options in downtown Alpharetta.
Amazing! Cocktails, food, service - everything was fantastic. Ask for Keri to serve you - she is knowledgeable and so professional! We can’t wait to go back.

Such a great experience! The food was absolutely amazing, and the drinks were outstanding. The managers seemed to be really involved with the staff and helped ensure every guest was well cared for. Our server, Gabrielle, was so incredibly sweet and made sure we had everything we needed. We will definitely be back soon!

FINALLY! A REAL MEZCAL BAR! Im so happy this made it to the burbs. Not only do they have the most impressive selection of mezcals, but they have the most delicious cocktails too! I recommend starting the evening off with a Sunburn Sour. Cody behind the bar really knows his stuff and his cocktail creations are most impressive. My favorite apps so far are the Tuna Cubes and the Snapper Crudo. I love how they have daily featured entrees too. I tried the Scallop feature Saturday with chili garlic, fried rice and grilled pineapple that was to die for. Everything we tried was so incredibly fresh and expertly prepared, you can easily see why this is a higher price point than most other seafood spots in the area. It’s WORTH IT! Oh, and you have to admire the absolutely gorgeous aesthetic of this spot. It’s really somewhere you want to spend the whole day/night - and we did! Cant wait to come back. Well done y’all!

Our evening at Lapeer was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The cocktails were creative, beautiful & absolutely delicious. The ambiance & decor were equally impressive. The food was delicious and presented beautifully. Service was exceptional as well. We will definitely be back. I wish I could give more than 5 stars! Sit at the bar and ask for Cody Brown, he's the best and knows so much about all the offerings. Definitely try some Mezcal!
Excellent service, extremely competent management, and the food was amazing. Fresh oysters, beef tartare was well seasoned, and drinks were superb. Well done.
